definition[0]: to develop something new, especially a strong relationship with other people, groups, or countries
example[0]: In 1776 the United States forged an alliance with France.
example[1]: The two women had forged a close bond.
example[2]: Back in the 1980s, they were attempting to forge a new kind of rock music.
definition[1]: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
example[3]: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
definition[2]: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
example[5]: Her speech wasn’t going down too well, but she forged on.
example[6]: Crowds of people forged through the streets towards the embassy.
example[7]: He forged into the lead in the fourth set.
definition[3]: to make something from a piece of metal by heating the metal and shaping it
definition[4]: a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects
definition[5]: a large piece of equipment that produces high temperatures, used for heating and shaping metal objects
definition[6]: to produce a document or money that is not GENUINE (=real), or to sign something with a false name
example[8]: They had forged some company documents and set up phoney  (=false) bank accounts.
example[9]: Someone stole my cheque book and forged my signature.
definition[7]: to establish a relationship of working together with another person, organization or country
example[10]: Air France also forged an alliance with Delta Air Lines, helped by a the open-skies deal between France and the U.S.
example[11]: A number of links have been forged between Danish and American companies.
example[12]: Both General Motors and Ford would like to forge a liaison with Jaguar.
example[13]: The US hopes to forge a closer economic relationship with East European countries.
definition[8]: to make an agreement with another person, organization, or country
example[14]: They forged an agreement with the Philips to produce two games using the electronics company’s Compact Disc-Interactive format.
